en.title: Triton's Treasure
en.subtitle: A Scientific Method Adventure
en.task_move-sub: Click around the screen to move the sub
en.hint_radio-code: Click the Scientific Method steps in the correct order
en.inventory-item_desc_radio: A communication device for contacting Mission Control.
en.inventory-item_action_radio: Use this to ask for hints if you are stuck.
en.inventory-item_desc_conch: Your new ocean friend. Grants the ability to understand the language of the sea.
en.inventory-item_action_conch: Use this to receive a hint whenever you are stuck.
en.inventory-item_desc_sm: A diagram of the Scientific Method.
en.inventory-item_action_sm: Use this to review the Scientific Method steps.
en.inventory-item_desc_pg:
An instrument for measuring underwater pressure.
Returns values in atm units, where 1 atm = the atmospheric pressure at sea level.
en.inventory-item_desc_dg:
An instrument for measuring underwater depth.
Measures pressure then calculates depth using their linear relationship. Returns values in meters.
en.inventory-item_desc_th:
A device for measuring water temperature.
Returns values in Celsius.
en.desc_shell:
A large sea snail with a horn-shaped shell.
There is something mysterious about this one...
en.desc_otter:
A cute marine mammal with thick fur.
Can live on land and in water.
en.intro_1: In an uncharted part of the Pacific Ocean lies the Triton's Triangle...
en.intro_2: a treacherous area where many ships mysteriously vanish.
en.intro_3: Sailors feared these waters, speaking of lurking sea monsters and strange forces.
en.intro_4: Yet, despite the danger, many still venture into the Triangle. Why?
en.intro_5: Because of a legend of something hidden deep below:
en.intro_6: a treasure of unimaginable value and beauty.
en.pl_1: Decades ago, the world’s first large-scale expedition into the Triangle set sail.
en.pl_2: With the best equipment, the crew was determined to retrieve the legendary treasure at any cost.
en.pl_3: However, they were reckless — upsetting the ocean's fragile balance and countless habitats.
en.pl_4: What happened next remains a mystery — whether they found the treasure or not, no one knows.
en.pl_5: Communication with the ship was abruptly lost,
en.pl_6: and the entire crew vanished without a trace...
en.brief-1: SM-Explorer, this is Mission Control. Just checking in - how's everything looking there?
en.brief-1_o1: Looking good so far. No sea monsters yet, so I'd call that a win.
en.brief-1_o1-1: Well, let’s hope it stays that way. But you know, anything’s possible out there.
en.brief-1_o2: Its beautiful here. The way the sunlight cuts through the water… I’ve never seen anything like it.
en.brief-1_o2-1: Glad to hear it. Enjoy it while you can, you won’t get much of the sunlight once you’re under.
en.brief-1_o3: Honestly, it's a little too quiet. This place makes me nervous...
en.brief-1_o3-1: That's understandable. We'll keep a close watch on your readings from here.
en.brief-2: Your mission is to explore the depths of the Triton's Triangle and gather valuable data.
en.brief-2_o2: Tell me more about this place.
en.brief-2_o2-1: To be honest, we don't know much...this ocean region is mostly uncharted.
en.brief-2_o2-2: Years ago, there was a mining expedition but the crew all went missing...
en.brief-2_o2-3: The only data we retrieved were some strange temperature readings from deep below.
en.brief-2_o2-3_o1-1: A temperature anomaly. Warm temperatures, at very deep depths.
en.brief-2_o2-3_o1-2: Which is unusual because generally the deep ocean is very cold.
en.brief-2_o3: How should I approach the mission?
en.brief-2_o3-1: Remember, the mission is not just about finding answers - it's about asking the right questions.
en.brief-2_o3-2: I recommend using the Scientific Method to guide your exploration.
en.brief-2_o3-3: A diagram is available in your inventory whenever you need a refresher.
en.brief-3: Double-check your equipment and begin your descent when you're ready.
en.brief-4: Don't hesitate to radio in if you have any questions. Good luck, SM-Explorer.
en.hint-1: Signal received SM-Explorer. What is your status?
en.hint-1_o1-default: All good here. Just saying hi.
en.hint-1_o1-default-1: Good to hear from you. Feel free to radio in whenever you need.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1: These are dangerous waters. Turn back now, for your own good.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1_o1: What?! A talking shell! That is so cool.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1_o1-1: Hey, are you listening? ...and don't call me a shell.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-2: Many treasure hunters have come, and many have gone missing.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3: Trust me. Leave now while you still can.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o1: Ok, but I will be back.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2: I can't leave now. I have a mission to complete.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-1: I'm not a treasure hunter. I'm an ocean explorer...and a scientist.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-2: I'm here to explore the depths of this place, and find out what happened to my dad.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-4: My dad was a scientist. He came here years ago and never returned.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-6: I see... I'm sorry about your dad.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-7: Look buddy, I want to help you... but I need to know that you can handle it first.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-8: Prove to me that you are really a scientist.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-4: Go make some observations around this place.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-5: Come back once you have some qualitative data to share with me.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-5_o2-1: Qualitative data are descriptions about things that are observed, but not measured precisely.
